00201 VL_INLINE void
00202 adv(int ndims, int const *dims, int *subs)
00203 {
00204   int d = 0 ;
00205   while(d < ndims) {
00206     if( ++subs[d]  < dims[d] ) return ;
00207     subs[d++] = 0 ;
00208   }
00209 }
00210 
00226 VL_INLINE vl_uint
00227 climb (VlMserReg* r, vl_uint idx) 
00228 {
00229   
00230   vl_uint prev_idx = idx ;
00231   vl_uint next_idx ;
00232   vl_uint root_idx ;
00233 
00234   /* move towards root to find it */
00235   while (1) {
00236     
00237     /* next jump to the root */
00238     next_idx = r [idx] .shortcut ;
00239     
00240     /* recycle shortcut to remember how we came here */
00241     r [idx] .shortcut = prev_idx ;
00242     
00243     /* stop if the root is found */
00244     if( next_idx == idx ) break ;
00245 
00246     /* next guy */
00247     prev_idx = idx ;
00248     idx      = next_idx ;
00249   }
00250 
00251   root_idx = idx ;
00252 
00253   /* move backward to update shortcuts */
00254   while (1) {
00255     
00256     /* get previously visited one */
00257     prev_idx = r [idx] .shortcut ;
00258     
00259     /* update shortcut to point to the new root */
00260     r [idx] .shortcut = root_idx ;
00261 
00262     /* stop if the first visited node is reached */
00263     if( prev_idx == idx ) break ;
00264     
00265     /* next guy */
00266     idx = prev_idx ;
00267   }
00268 
00269   return root_idx ;
00270 }
00271 
00282 VL_EXPORT
00283 VlMserFilt*
00284 vl_mser_new (int ndims, int const* dims)
00285 {
00286   VlMserFilt* f ;
00287   int *strides, k ;
00288 
00289   f = vl_calloc (sizeof(VlMserFilt), 1) ;
00290 
00291   f-> ndims   = ndims ;
00292   f-> dims    = vl_malloc (sizeof(int) * ndims) ;
00293   f-> subs    = vl_malloc (sizeof(int) * ndims) ;
00294   f-> dsubs   = vl_malloc (sizeof(int) * ndims) ;
00295   f-> strides = vl_malloc (sizeof(int) * ndims) ;
00296 
00297   /* shortcuts */
00298   strides = f-> strides ;
00299 
00300   /* copy dims to f->dims */
00301   for(k = 0 ; k < ndims ; ++k) {
00302     f-> dims [k] = dims [k] ;
00303   }
00304   
00305   /* compute strides to move into the N-dimensional image array */
00306   strides [0] = 1 ;
00307   for(k = 1 ; k < ndims ; ++k) {
00308     strides [k] = strides [k-1] * dims [k-1] ;
00309   }
00310   
00311   /* total number of pixels */
00312   f-> nel = strides [ndims-1] * dims [ndims-1] ;
00313   
00314   /* dof of ellipsoids */
00315   f-> dof = ndims * (ndims + 1) / 2 + ndims ;
00316 
00317   /* more buffers */
00318   f-> perm   = vl_malloc (sizeof(vl_uint)   * f-> nel) ;
00319   f-> joins  = vl_malloc (sizeof(vl_uint)   * f-> nel) ;
00320   f-> r      = vl_malloc (sizeof(VlMserReg) * f-> nel) ;
00321 
00322   f-> er     = 0 ;
00323   f-> rer    = 0 ;
00324   f-> mer    = 0 ;
00325   f-> rmer   = 0 ;
00326   f-> ell    = 0 ;
00327   f-> rell   = 0 ;
00328 
00329   /* other parameters */
00330   f-> delta         = 5 ;
00331   f-> max_area      = 0.75 ;
00332   f-> min_area      = 3.0 / f-> nel ;
00333   f-> max_variation = 0.25 ;
00334   f-> min_diversity = 0.2 ;
00335 
00336   return f ;
00337 }
00338 
00346 VL_EXPORT
00347 void
00348 vl_mser_delete (VlMserFilt* f)
00349 {
00350   if(f) {
00351     if(f-> acc   )  vl_free( f-> acc    ) ;
00352     if(f-> ell   )  vl_free( f-> ell    ) ;
00353 
00354     if(f-> er    )  vl_free( f-> er     ) ;
00355     if(f-> r     )  vl_free( f-> r      ) ;
00356     if(f-> joins )  vl_free( f-> joins  ) ;
00357     if(f-> perm  )  vl_free( f-> perm   ) ;
00358     
00359     if(f-> strides) vl_free( f-> strides) ;
00360     if(f-> dsubs  ) vl_free( f-> dsubs  ) ;
00361     if(f-> subs   ) vl_free( f-> subs   ) ;
00362     if(f-> dims   ) vl_free( f-> dims   ) ;
00363 
00364     if(f-> mer    ) vl_free( f-> mer    ) ;
00365     vl_free (f) ;
00366   }
00367 }
00368 
00369 
00382 VL_EXPORT
00383 void
00384 vl_mser_process (VlMserFilt* f, vl_mser_pix const* im)
00385 {
00386   /* shortcuts */
00387   vl_uint        nel     = f-> nel  ;
00388   vl_uint       *perm    = f-> perm ;
00389   vl_uint       *joins   = f-> joins ;
00390   int            ndims   = f-> ndims ;
00391   int           *dims    = f-> dims ;
00392   int           *subs    = f-> subs ;
00393   int           *dsubs   = f-> dsubs ;
00394   int           *strides = f-> strides ;
00395   VlMserReg     *r       = f-> r ;
00396   VlMserExtrReg *er      = f-> er ;
00397   vl_uint       *mer     = f-> mer ;
00398   int            delta   = f-> delta ;
00399 
00400   int njoins = 0 ;
00401   int ner    = 0 ;
00402   int nmer   = 0 ;
00403   int nbig   = 0 ;
00404   int nsmall = 0 ;
00405   int nbad   = 0 ;
00406   int ndup   = 0 ;
00407 
00408   int i, j, k ;
00409 
00410   /* delete any previosuly computed ellipsoid */
00411   f-> nell = 0 ;
00412 
00413   /* -----------------------------------------------------------------
00414    *                                          Sort pixels by intensity
00415    * -------------------------------------------------------------- */
00416   
00417   {
00418     vl_uint buckets [ VL_MSER_PIX_MAXVAL ] ;
00419 
00420     /* clear buckets */
00421     memset (buckets, 0, sizeof(vl_uint) * VL_MSER_PIX_MAXVAL ) ;
00422 
00423     /* compute bucket size (how many pixels for each intensity
00424        value) */
00425     for(i = 0 ; i < nel ; ++i) {
00426       vl_mser_pix v = im [i] ;
00427       ++ buckets [v] ;
00428     }
00429 
00430     /* cumulatively add bucket sizes */
00431     for(i = 1 ; i < VL_MSER_PIX_MAXVAL ; ++i) {
00432       buckets [i] += buckets [i-1] ;
00433     }
00434     
00435     /* empty buckets computing pixel ordering */
00436     for(i = nel ; i >= 1 ; ) {
00437       vl_mser_pix v = im [ --i ] ;
00438       vl_uint j = -- buckets [v] ;
00439       perm [j] = i ;
00440     }
00441   }
00442 
00443   /* initialize the forest with all void nodes */
00444   for(i = 0 ; i < nel ; ++i) {
00445     r [i] .parent = VL_MSER_VOID_NODE ;
00446   }
00447 
00448   /* -----------------------------------------------------------------
00449    *                        Compute regions and count extremal regions
00450    * -------------------------------------------------------------- */
00451   /* 
00452      In the following:
00453 
00454      idx    : index of the current pixel
00455      val    : intensity of the current pixel
00456      r_idx  : index of the root of the current pixel
00457      n_idx  : index of the neighbors of the current pixel
00458      nr_idx : index of the root of the neighbor of the current pixel
00459 
00460   */
00461   
00462   /* process each pixel by increasing intensity */
00463   for(i = 0 ; i < nel ; ++i) {
00464     
00465     /* pop next node xi */
00466     vl_uint     idx = perm [i] ;  
00467     vl_mser_pix val = im [idx] ;
00468     vl_uint     r_idx ;
00469     
00470     /* add the pixel to the forest as a root for now */
00471     r [idx] .parent   = idx ;
00472     r [idx] .shortcut = idx ;
00473     r [idx] .area     = 1 ;
00474     r [idx] .height   = 1 ;
00475 
00476     r_idx = idx ;
00477    
00478     /* convert the index IDX into the subscript SUBS; also initialize
00479        DSUBS to (-1,-1,...,-1) */
00480     {
00481       vl_uint temp = idx ;
00482       for(k = ndims - 1 ; k >= 0 ; --k) {
00483         dsubs [k] = -1 ;
00484         subs  [k] = temp / strides [k] ;
00485         temp      = temp % strides [k] ;
00486       }
00487     }
00488     
00489     /* examine the neighbors of the current pixel */
00490     while (1) {
00491       vl_uint n_idx = 0 ;
00492       vl_bool good = 1 ;
00493 
00494       /* 
00495          Compute the neighbor subscript as NSUBS+SUB, the
00496          corresponding neighbor index NINDEX and check that the
00497          neighbor is within the image domain.
00498       */
00499       for(k = 0 ; k < ndims && good ; ++k) {
00500         int temp  = dsubs [k] + subs [k] ;
00501         good     &= (0 <= temp) && (temp < dims [k]) ;
00502         n_idx    += temp * strides [k] ;
00503       }
00504 
00505       /* 
00506          The neighbor should be processed if the following conditions
00507          are met:
00508 
00509          1. The neighbor is within image boundaries.
00510 
00511          2. The neighbor is indeed different from the current node
00512             (the opposite happens when DSUB=(0,0,...,0)).
00513 
00514          3. The neighbor is already in the forest, meaning that it has
00515             already been processed.
00516       */
00517       if (good && 
00518           n_idx != idx &&
00519           r [n_idx] .parent != VL_MSER_VOID_NODE ) {
00520 
00521         vl_mser_pix nr_val = 0 ;
00522         vl_uint     nr_idx = 0 ;
00523         int         hgt   = r [ r_idx] .height ;
00524         int         n_hgt = r [nr_idx] .height ;
00525         
00526         /*
00527           Now we join the two subtrees rooted at
00528           
00529            R_IDX = ROOT(  IDX) 
00530           NR_IDX = ROOT(N_IDX).
00531           
00532           Note that R_IDX = ROOT(IDX) might change as we process more
00533           neighbors, so we need keep updating it. 
00534         */
00535         
00536          r_idx = climb(r,   idx) ;
00537         nr_idx = climb(r, n_idx) ;
00538         
00539         /*  
00540           At this point we have three possibilities:
00541           
00542           (A) ROOT(IDX) == ROOT(NR_IDX). In this case the two trees
00543               have already been joined and we do not do anything.
00544           
00545           (B) I(ROOT(IDX)) == I(ROOT(NR_IDX)). In this case the pixel
00546               IDX is extending an extremal region with the same
00547               intensity value. Since ROOT(NR_IDX) will NOT be an
00548               extremal region of the full image, ROOT(IDX) can be
00549               safely added as children of ROOT(NR_IDX) if this
00550               reduces the height according to the union rank
00551               heuristic.
00552                
00553           (C) I(ROOT(IDX)) > I(ROOT(NR_IDX)). In this case the pixel
00554               IDX is starting a new extremal region. Thus ROOT(NR_IDX)
00555               WILL be an extremal region of the final image and the
00556               only possibility is to add ROOT(NR_IDX) as children of
00557               ROOT(IDX), which becomes parent.
00558         */
00559 
00560         if( r_idx != nr_idx ) { /* skip if (A) */
00561 
00562           nr_val = im [nr_idx] ;
00563 
00564           if( nr_val == val && hgt < n_hgt ) {
00565 
00566             /* ROOT(IDX) becomes the child */
00567             r [r_idx]  .parent   = nr_idx ;
00568             r [r_idx]  .shortcut = nr_idx ;          
00569             r [nr_idx] .area    += r [r_idx] .area ;
00570             r [nr_idx] .height   = VL_MAX(n_hgt, hgt+1) ;
00571 
00572             joins [njoins++] = r_idx ;
00573 
00574           } else {
00575 
00576             /* cases ROOT(IDX) becomes the parent */
00577             r [nr_idx] .parent   = r_idx ;
00578             r [nr_idx] .shortcut = r_idx ;
00579             r [r_idx]  .area    += r [nr_idx] .area ;
00580             r [r_idx]  .height   = VL_MAX(hgt, n_hgt + 1) ;
00581 
00582             joins [njoins++] = nr_idx ; 
00583 
00584             /* count if extremal */
00585             if (nr_val != val) ++ ner ;
00586 
00587           } /* check b vs c */
00588         } /* check a vs b or c */        
00589       } /* neighbor done */
00590 
00591       /* move to next neighbor */      
00592       k = 0 ;
00593       while(++ dsubs [k] > 1) {
00594         dsubs [k++] = -1 ;
00595         if(k == ndims) goto done_all_neighbors ;
00596       }
00597     } /* next neighbor */
00598   done_all_neighbors : ;
00599   } /* next pixel */    
00600 
00601   /* the last root is extremal too */
00602   ++ ner ;
00603 
00604   /* save back */
00605   f-> njoins = njoins ;
00606 
00607   f-> stats. num_extremal = ner ;
00608 
00609   /* -----------------------------------------------------------------
00610    *                                          Extract extremal regions
00611    * -------------------------------------------------------------- */
00612 
00613   /* 
00614      Extremal regions are extracted and stored into the array ER.  The
00615      structure R is also updated so that .SHORTCUT indexes the
00616      corresponding extremal region if any (otherwise it is set to
00617      VOID).
00618   */
00619  
00620   /* make room */
00621   if (f-> rer < ner) {
00622     if (er) vl_free (er) ;
00623     f->er  = er = vl_malloc (sizeof(VlMserExtrReg) * ner) ;
00624     f->rer = ner ;      
00625   } ;
00626 
00627   /* save back */
00628   f-> nmer = ner ;
00629 
00630   /* count again */
00631   ner = 0 ;
00632 
00633   /* scan all regions Xi */
00634   for(i = 0 ; i < nel ; ++i) {
00635 
00636     /* pop next node xi */
00637     vl_uint     idx = perm [i] ;  
00638 
00639     vl_mser_pix val   = im [idx] ;
00640     vl_uint     p_idx = r  [idx] .parent ;
00641     vl_mser_pix p_val = im [p_idx] ;
00642 
00643     /* is extremal ? */
00644     vl_bool is_extr = (p_val > val) || idx == p_idx ;
00645     
00646     if( is_extr ) {
00647 
00648       /* if so, add it */      
00649       er [ner] .index      = idx ;
00650       er [ner] .parent     = ner ;
00651       er [ner] .value      = im [idx] ;
00652       er [ner] .area       = r  [idx] .area ;
00653       
00654       /* link this region to this extremal region */
00655       r [idx] .shortcut = ner ;
00656 
00657       /* increase count */
00658       ++ ner ;
00659     } else {      
00660       /* link this region to void */
00661       r [idx] .shortcut =   VL_MSER_VOID_NODE ;
00662     }
00663   }
00664 
00665   /* -----------------------------------------------------------------
00666    *                                   Link extremal regions in a tree
00667    * -------------------------------------------------------------- */
00668 
00669   for(i = 0 ; i < ner ; ++i) {
00670 
00671     vl_uint idx = er [i] .index ;
00672 
00673     do {
00674       idx = r[idx] .parent ;
00675     } while (r[idx] .shortcut == VL_MSER_VOID_NODE) ;
00676 
00677     er[i] .parent   = r[idx] .shortcut ;
00678     er[i] .shortcut = i ;
00679   }
00680 
00681   /* -----------------------------------------------------------------
00682    *                            Compute variability of +DELTA branches
00683    * -------------------------------------------------------------- */
00684   /* For each extremal region Xi of value VAL we look for the biggest
00685    * parent that has value not greater than VAL+DELTA. This is dubbed
00686    * `top parent'. */
00687 
00688   for(i = 0 ; i < ner ; ++i) {
00689 
00690     /* Xj is the current region the region and Xj are the parents */
00691     int     top_val = er [i] .value + delta ;
00692     int     top     = er [i] .shortcut ;
00693    
00694     /* examine all parents */
00695     while (1) {
00696       int next     = er [top]  .parent ;
00697       int next_val = er [next] .value ;
00698       
00699       /* Break if:
00700        * - there is no node above the top or
00701        * - the next node is above the top value. 
00702        */
00703       if (next == top || next_val > top_val) break ;
00704             
00705       /* so next could be the top */
00706       top = next ;
00707     }
00708     
00709     /* calculate branch variation */
00710     {
00711       int area     = er [i  ] .area ;
00712       int area_top = er [top] .area ;
00713       er [i] .variation  = (float) (area_top - area) / area ;
00714       er [i] .max_stable = 1 ;
00715     }
00716         
00717     /* Optimization: since extremal regions are processed by
00718      * increasing intensity, all next extremal regions being processed
00719      * have value at least equal to the one of Xi. If any of them has
00720      * parent the parent of Xi (this comprises the parent itself), we
00721      * can safely skip most intermediate node along the branch and
00722      * skip directly to the top to start our search. */
00723     {
00724       int parent = er [i] .parent ;
00725       int curr   = er [parent] .shortcut ;
00726       er [parent] .shortcut =  VL_MAX (top, curr) ;
00727     }
00728   }
00729     
00730   /* -----------------------------------------------------------------
00731    *                                  Select maximally stable branches
00732    * -------------------------------------------------------------- */
00733     
00734   nmer = ner ;
00735   for(i = 0 ; i < ner ; ++i) {
00736     vl_uint    parent = er [i     ] .parent ;
00737     vl_mser_pix   val = er [i     ] .value ;
00738     float     var = er [i     ] .variation ;
00739     vl_mser_pix p_val = er [parent] .value ;
00740     float   p_var = er [parent] .variation ;
00741     vl_uint     loser ;
00742     
00743     /* 
00744        Notice that R_parent = R_{l+1} only if p_val = val + 1. If not,
00745        this and the parent region coincide and there is nothing to do.
00746     */
00747     if(p_val > val + 1) continue ;
00748 
00749     /* decide which one to keep and put that in loser */
00750     if(var < p_var) loser = parent ; else loser = i ;
00751     
00752     /* make loser NON maximally stable */
00753     if(er [loser] .max_stable) {
00754       -- nmer ;
00755       er [loser] .max_stable = 0 ;
00756     }
00757   }
00758   
00759   f-> stats. num_unstable = ner - nmer ;
00760 
00761   /* -----------------------------------------------------------------
00762    *                                                 Further filtering
00763    * -------------------------------------------------------------- */
00764   /* It is critical for correct duplicate detection to remove regions
00765    * from the bottom (smallest one first).                          */
00766   {
00767     float max_area = (float) f-> max_area * nel ;
00768     float min_area = (float) f-> min_area * nel ;
00769     float max_var  = (float) f-> max_variation ;
00770     float min_div  = (float) f-> min_diversity ;
00771 
00772     /* scan all extremal regions (intensity value order) */
00773     for(i = ner-1 ; i >= 0L  ; --i) {
00774       
00775       /* process only maximally stable extremal regions */
00776       if (! er [i] .max_stable) continue ;
00777       
00778       if (er [i] .variation >= max_var ) { ++ nbad ;   goto remove ; }
00779       if (er [i] .area      >  max_area) { ++ nbig ;   goto remove ; }
00780       if (er [i] .area      <  min_area) { ++ nsmall ; goto remove ; }
00781       
00782       /* 
00783        * Remove duplicates 
00784        */
00785       if (min_div < 1.0) {
00786         vl_uint   parent = er [i] .parent ;
00787         int       area, p_area ;
00788         float div ;
00789         
00790         /* check all but the root mser */
00791         if(parent != i) {
00792           
00793           /* search for the maximally stable parent region */
00794           while(! er [parent] .max_stable) {
00795             vl_uint next = er [parent] .parent ;
00796             if(next == parent) break ;
00797             parent = next ;
00798           }
00799           
00800           /* Compare with the parent region; if the current and parent
00801            * regions are too similar, keep only the parent. */
00802           area    = er [i]      .area ;
00803           p_area  = er [parent] .area ;
00804           div     = (float) (p_area - area) / (float) p_area ;
00805           
00806           if (div < min_div) { ++ ndup ; goto remove ; }
00807         } /* remove dups end */
00808 
00809       }
00810       continue ;
00811     remove :
00812       er [i] .max_stable = 0 ;
00813       -- nmer ;      
00814     } /* check next region */
00815 
00816     f-> stats .num_abs_unstable = nbad ;
00817     f-> stats .num_too_big      = nbig ;
00818     f-> stats .num_too_small    = nsmall ;
00819     f-> stats .num_duplicates   = ndup ;
00820   }
00821   /* -----------------------------------------------------------------
00822    *                                                   Save the result
00823    * -------------------------------------------------------------- */
00824 
00825   /* make room */
00826   if (f-> rmer < nmer) {
00827     if (mer) vl_free (mer) ;
00828     f->mer  = mer = vl_malloc( sizeof(vl_uint) * nmer) ;
00829     f->rmer = nmer ;      
00830   }
00831 
00832   /* save back */
00833   f-> nmer = nmer ;
00834 
00835   j = 0 ;
00836   for (i = 0 ; i < ner ; ++i) {
00837     if (er [i] .max_stable) mer [j++] = er [i] .index ;
00838   }
00839 }
00840 
00849 VL_EXPORT
00850 void
00851 vl_mser_ell_fit (VlMserFilt* f)
00852 {
00853   /* shortcuts */
00854   int                nel = f-> nel ;
00855   int                dof = f-> dof ;
00856   int              *dims = f-> dims ;
00857   int              ndims = f-> ndims ;
00858   int              *subs = f-> subs ;
00859   int             njoins = f-> njoins ;
00860   vl_uint         *joins = f-> joins ;
00861   VlMserReg           *r = f-> r ;
00862   vl_uint           *mer = f-> mer ;
00863   int               nmer = f-> nmer ;
00864   vl_mser_acc       *acc = f-> acc ;
00865   vl_mser_acc       *ell = f-> ell ; 
00866 
00867   int d, index, i, j ;
00868   
00869   /* already fit ? */
00870   if (f->nell == f->nmer) return ;
00871   
00872   /* make room */
00873   if (f->rell < f->nmer) {
00874     if (f->ell) vl_free (f->ell) ;
00875     f->ell  = vl_malloc (sizeof(float) * f->nmer * f->dof) ;
00876     f->rell = f-> nmer ;
00877   }
00878 
00879   if (f->acc == 0) {
00880     f->acc = vl_malloc (sizeof(float) * f->nel) ;
00881   }
00882  
00883   acc = f-> acc ;
00884   ell = f-> ell ; 
00885      
00886   /* -----------------------------------------------------------------
00887    *                                                 Integrate moments
00888    * -------------------------------------------------------------- */
00889      
00890   /* for each dof */
00891   for(d = 0 ; d < f->dof ; ++d) {
00892 
00893     /* start from the upper-left pixel (0,0,...,0) */
00894     memset (subs, 0, sizeof(int) * ndims) ;
00895         
00896     /* step 1: fill acc pretending that each region has only one pixel */
00897     if(d < ndims) {
00898       /* 1-order ................................................... */
00899   
00900       for(index = 0 ; index < nel ; ++ index) {
00901         acc [index] = subs [d] ;
00902         adv(ndims, dims, subs) ;
00903       }      
00904     }
00905     else {      
00906       /* 2-order ................................................... */
00907 
00908       /* map the dof d to a second order moment E[x_i x_j] */      
00909       i = d - ndims ; 
00910       j = 0 ;
00911       while(i > j) {
00912         i -= j + 1 ;
00913         j ++ ;
00914       }      
00915       /* initialize acc with  x_i * x_j */
00916       for(index = 0 ; index < nel ; ++ index){
00917         acc [index] = subs [i] * subs [j] ;
00918         adv(ndims, dims, subs) ;
00919       }
00920     }
00921         
00922     /* step 2: integrate */
00923     for(i = 0 ; i < njoins ; ++i) {      
00924       vl_uint index  = joins [i] ;
00925       vl_uint parent = r [index] .parent ;
00926       acc [parent] += acc [index] ;
00927     }
00928     
00929     /* step 3: save back to ellpises */
00930     for(i = 0 ; i < nmer ; ++i) {      
00931       vl_uint idx = mer [i] ;
00932       ell [d + dof*i] = acc [idx] ;
00933     }
00934     
00935   }  /* next dof */
00936 
00937   /* -----------------------------------------------------------------
00938    *                                           Compute central moments
00939    * -------------------------------------------------------------- */
00940 
00941   for(index = 0 ; index < nmer ; ++index) {
00942     float  *pt  = ell + index * dof ;
00943     vl_uint    idx  = mer [index] ;
00944     float  area = r [idx] .area ;
00945     
00946     for(d = 0 ; d < dof ; ++d) {
00947 
00948       pt [d] /= area ; 
00949 
00950       if(d >= ndims) {
00951         /* remove squared mean from moment to get variance */
00952         i = d - ndims ; 
00953         j = 0 ;
00954         while(i > j) {
00955           i -= j + 1 ;
00956           j ++ ;
00957         }
00958         pt [d] -= pt [i] * pt [j] ;
00959       }
00960 
00961     }
00962   }
00963 
00964   /* save back */
00965   f-> nell = nmer ;
00966 }
00967
